newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products slide as crude futures dip.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products slide as crude futures dip.

text.p: NWE oil products were softer on Friday, losing some of the strength picked up mid-week.
Gas oil lost nearly $3 a tonne on the back of weaker futures and some loss of strength in premiums for barges and DIN cargoes. Russian premiums held.
Gasoline was slightly weaker on softer underlying crude as well as healthy supply. Naphtha eased as prices in dominant Asian market dipped.
High sulphur fuel oil cargo dipped $4 to $83 cif NWE amid plentiful supply and thin interest. Barges dropped $2 with trade healthy.
Low sulphur prices were still held down by weakness in the straight-run market.
